author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
A large section of textile exporters in the district feel that the banks should treat the defaulters with dignity, as many of the small and medium scale exporters could not repay the loans on time only due to market vagaries that were beyond their control.

“We are upset because that some of the banks are publishing photographs of the defaulters in newspapers, and erecting flex boards at the bank branches. This is unwarranted considering that the banks have issued loans against mortgaging property,” said M.P. Muthurathinam, president of Tirupur Exporters and Manufacturers Association.

He said that the banks were granting about 70 per cent of the value of the properties mortgaged as loans.

The banks could easily recover the payments by selling off the properties.

Shaming the businessmen could even lead to suicides, he added.

A large section of small and medium scale exporters have sent a representation to Prime Minister Narendra Modi requesting the government to direct banks against publishing photographs of defaulters, and instead help them restructure the bad loans.

Not harassment

Banking sources said that photographs were published only in the case of ‘intentional defaulters’ who either had been given ample opportunities to repay the loan, or were found to have diverted the funds obtained as loans for some other purposes.

Photographs are published to create make society know the persons who did not repay the public money, said a bank official.
title: ‘Treat loan defaulters with dignity’
